Post Affiliate Pro is made in a way that it can work with the default configuration.
However, you should check the configuration and fine tune it for your own needs.
You can find the configuration screen under the Config & Tools menu -> Configuration.

The detailed description of all configuration options can be found in the user's guide or knowledgebase.

Manage your campaigns here.
Campaign represents a product or group of products that have the same commissions. You can create unlimited number of campaigns.
Overview of your campaigns and commissions generated

One default campaign is created during the installation. You can modify it, or create your own campaigns.

Campaigns are used to group a set of products (or only one product) that have the same commission settings.

For example, you can have campaign for Product1, where you'll reward your affiliates per click, and another campaign for Product2, where affiliate receives commissions per sale.

Or you can have campaign called Low cost products, which will have 40% per sale commissions, and another campaign called Expensive products with 15% per sale commission.

Manage your banners here.
You can create banners of different types, like image banners, text links, Flash or HTML banners.
Every banner belongs to a campaign (that defines commissions for the referral), and it can link to any target URL.

In the Banners manager you can various creatives, from text links, standard image banners to HTML, Flash and promo email banners.
Every banner must have destination URL specified - it is the URL where the visitor is redirected after click.

  • email notifications – you can configure what kind of notifications you would like to receive as merchant, and what notifications will be available for affiliates.

The best is to simulate the whole process from affiliate’s and your point of view:
  1. Sign up as some testing affiliate – after approval you should receive confirmation email with your password, and you should be able to log in to your affiliate panel

source:
If main commission structure should be set to 1st tier 5%; 2nd tier 4% and 3rd tier 3% the formula would look like %3-%4-%5. In case you want to payout flat commission, the formula requires only numbers: 3-4-5. This structure defines tiers from right to left, meaning the first one from left is top tier, then their child, then grandchild etc... The missing tier commission always goes to the parent affiliate (from right to left).

E.g. in case of five levels %2-%2-%2-%4-%5 the commission structure changes like this, if the last affiliate is missing:
All 5 tiers: %2-%2-%2-%4-%5
4 tiers: %2-%2-%2-%9
3 tiers: %2-%2-%11
2 tiers: %2-%13
1 tier: %15
translation:
If main commission structure should be set to 1st tier 5%; 2nd tier 4% and 3rd tier 3% the formula would look like %3-%4-%5. In case you want to payout flat commission, the formula requires only numbers: 3-4-5. This structure defines tiers from right to left, meaning the first one from left is top tier, then their child, then grandchild etc... The missing tier commission always goes to the parent affiliate (from right to left).

E.g. in case of five levels %2-%2-%2-%4-%5 the commission structure changes like this, if the last affiliate is missing:
All 5 tiers: %2-%2-%2-%4-%5
4 tiers: %2-%2-%2-%9
3 tiers: %2-%2-%11

source:
Example 1:
Let's have the main commission structure set like this: 1st tier 50%; 2nd tier 30% and 3rd tier 20%. Now here are some cases:
  • Commission for all 3 tiers: Every tier gets the commission noramlly (50%, 30%, 20%)
  • Commission for 2 tiers: The 1st tier gets 50% and the 2nd tier gets 'totalcost' - 50%(lower tiers)
  • Commission for 1 tier: The 1st tier gets commission of 'totalcost' - 0(there is no lower tier) = 100%
Example 2:
Let's have the main commission structure set like this: 1st tier 30%; 2nd tier 20% and 3rd tier 10%, for all tiers the commission is 60%. Now here are some cases:
  • Commission for all 3 tiers: Every tier gets the commission noramlly (30%, 20%, 10%)
  • Commission for 2 tiers: The 1st tier gets 30% and the 2nd tier gets 'totalcost' - 30%(lower tiers) = 70%, for all tiers the commission is 100%!
  • Commission for 1 tier: The 1st tier gets commission of 'totalcost' - 0(there is no lower tier), so for all tiers the commission is 100%!
